text: The Wadden Sea is a part of the North Sea. It is an intertidal zone, up to wide. It runs from the Netherlands to the South of Denmark. It is up to of coastline. The land that appears at low tide is called mudflat in English (and Watt in German). It is at the origin of the latter name. Category:North Sea Category:Geography of Denmark Category:Bodies of water of Germany Category:Landforms of the Netherlands Category:World Heritage Sites in Germany Category:World Heritage Sites in the Netherlands
title: Wadden Sea
